comment.author: 54504478@N00
comment._content: There seem to be a lot of grey-eyed people in this collection. I didn't even know it was a real eye color, I've never seen a driver's license describe someone as grey eyed, and I've carded people at big events. A European thing? Were they persecuted by the law?

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content:
Grey eyes are now more commonly viewed as light blue/green colours, but they are perhaps more common in Europe then anywhere else. 
These criminals were convicted of a crime specified in section 20 of the Prevention of Crimes Act, 1871 and reported to the Secretary of State [Home Secretary] as being imprisoned in Newcastle Gaol between December 1871 - December 1873.

comment.author: 63835584@N08
comment._content: I think the eye color description is mistaken... It's more of a sepia color

comment.author: 65142822@N07
comment._content: My mother (Scots-Irish heritage - born here in 1929) had grey eyes. No blue or green - just grey.

comment._content: I put gray on my driver's license :)
